events.title: Publication of the Gutenberg Bible
events.description: Johannes Gutenberg completes the printing of the Gutenberg Bible, the first major book printed using movable type in Europe.
events.significance: This milestone marks the start of the age of the printed book, revolutionizing knowledge dissemination and literacy in Europe.

events.title: Battle of the Alamo Begins
events.description: Mexican forces begin their siege of the Alamo Mission in San Antonio during the Texas Revolution.
events.significance: The battle becomes a symbol of resistance and sacrifice in the fight for Texas independence.

events.title: USS Maine Explodes in Havana Harbor
events.description: The American battleship USS Maine explodes and sinks in Havana Harbor, killing over 260 crew members.
events.significance: The incident escalates tensions between the United States and Spain, contributing to the start of the Spanish-American War.

events.title: Soviets Raise Flag over Reichstag
events.description: Soviet soldiers raise the red flag over the Reichstag building in Berlin, symbolizing victory in the Battle of Berlin during World War II.
events.significance: Signifies the impending defeat of Nazi Germany and the end of the war in Europe.

events.title: Senator Joseph McCarthy Accuses U.S. Army of Communism
events.description: Senator Joseph McCarthy begins his claims accusing the U.S. Army of harboring communists during a televised hearing.
events.significance: Marks a turning point in McCarthyism and anti-communist sentiments in the United States.
